TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: told by Giłgiław of Vałulu village

S.FORM: izua za mareqali tia lutjuk kati qam.
izoa za mareqali tia lotjok kati qam.
S.TRANSL: There were two friends, Rabbit and Ant-eater.

S.FORM: "qalian, ari kiqaqiłi," aya ti qam tjai lutjuk.
"qalian, ari kiqaqilji," aya ti qam tjai lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “Friend, let’s go and collect tubers,” said Ant-eater to Rabbit.
“Right, let’s go,” said Rabbit.

S.FORM: pai vaik tia mareqali a kiqaqił.
pai vaik tia mareqali a kiqaqilj.
S.TRANSL: So the friends went off to collect tubers.

S.FORM: nu kemali ti lutjuk, savid a namapatsek.
no kemali ti lotjok, savid a namapacek.
S.TRANSL: When Rabbit dug, all the tubers were damaged (by his digging-stick).
When Ant-eater dug, he found big tubers.
“Friend, what do you do when you dig?

S.FORM: nu kemali aken, mapatsek sakamaya," aya ti lutjuk.
no kemali aken, mapacek sakamaya," aya ti lotjok.
S.TRANSL: When I dig the tubers are all damaged,” said Rabbit.

S.FORM: "tja patsekan a tja lima, qalian," aya ti qam.
"tja pacekan a tja lima, qalian," aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: “We jab our arms, friend,” said Ant-eater.
Rabbit jabbed his arm.

S.FORM: "ananananananana," aya ti lutjuk; "aku nu ku patsekan sa ku lima, qalian, saqetju?" aya ti lutjuk tjai qam.
"ananananananana," aya ti lotjok; "ako no ko pacekan sa ko lima, qalian, saqetjo?" aya ti lotjok tjai qam.
S.TRANSL: “Oow!” said Rabbit; “why does it hurt when I jab my arm?” said Rabbit to Ant-eater.

S.FORM: "manu, 'patseki a su lima,' nu aya ken, su patsekan a su lima?" aya ti qam.
"mano, 'paceki a so lima,' no aya ken, so pacekan a so lima?" aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: “Well did you really jab your arm when I told you to?” said Ant-eater.

S.FORM: "pai ari, tja tapiaw anga, qalian, sa tja qaqił," aya ti lutjuk.
"pai ari, tja tapiaw anga, qalian, sa tja qaqilj," aya ti lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “Well come on, friend, let’s roast our tubers in an earth-oven,” said Rabbit.
“Right, let’s,” said Ant-eater.
So off the friends went.

S.FORM: "ari kikasivi," aya ti qam tjai lutjuk.
"ari kikasivi," aya ti qam tjai lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “Let’s collect some wood,” said Ant-eater to Rabbit.
The friends went to collect wood.

S.FORM: manu neka nu kasiw ni lutjuk.
mano neka no kasiw ni lotjok.
S.TRANSL: But Rabbit couldn’t find any wood.

S.FORM: "su kudain, qalian, nu kikasiw sun?" aya ti lutjuk.
"so kodain, qalian, no kikasiw son?" aya ti lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “What do you do, friend, when you collect wood?” said Rabbit.

S.FORM: "tja seqasen a tja lima," aya ti qam.
"tja seqasen a tja lima," aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: “We cut our arms,” said Ant-eater.
Rabbit cut his arm.

S.FORM: "ananananananana," aya ti lutjuk; "aku nu ku seqasen a ku lima, qalian, saqetju?" aya ti lutjuk.
"ananananananana," aya ti lotjok; "ako no ko seqasen a ko lima, qalian, saqetjo?" aya ti lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “Oow!” said Rabbit; “why does it hurt, friend, when I cut my arm?” said Rabbit.

S.FORM: "manu, 'seqasu a su lima,' nu aya ken, su seqasen a su lima?" aya ti qam.
"mano, 'seqaso a so lima,' no aya ken, so seqasen a so lima?" aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: “Well did you really cut your arm when I told you to?” said Ant-eater.

S.FORM: "pai ari tapii anga, qalian," aya ti lutjuk.
"pai ari tapii anga, qalian," aya ti lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “Well come on, friend, let’s roast the tubers,” said Rabbit.
“Right, let’s,” said Ant-eater.

S.FORM: pai vaik tia mareqali a temapi.
pai vaik tia mareqali a temapi.
S.TRANSL: So the friends went to roast the tubers.

S.FORM: ka makatapi, "ari, qalian, vaiki a łemanguy," aya ti qam.
ka makatapi, "ari, qalian, vaiki a ljemangoy," aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished roasting them, Ant-eater said: “Come on, friend, let’s go swimming.”
“Right, let’s,” said Rabbit.

S.FORM: pai vaik tia mareqali a łemanguy.
pai vaik tia mareqali a ljemangoy.
S.TRANSL: So the friends went off to swim.

S.FORM: "pai katjaisangasu," aya ti qam tjai lutjuk.
"pai katjaisangaso," aya ti qam tjai lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “All right, you go first,” said Ant-eater to Rabbit.
“All right,” said Rabbit.
Rabbit dived in.

S.FORM: malipat a kula, sevatsavatsaq a qulu.
malipat a kola, sevacavacaq a qolo.
S.TRANSL: As soon as his legs went under the water his head came out.

S.FORM: "pai anga, tisunay anga," aya ti lutjuk tjai qam.
"pai anga, tisonay anga," aya ti lotjok tjai qam.
S.TRANSL: “All right then, it’s your turn,” said Rabbit to Ant-eater.
“All right,” said Ant-eater.
Ant-eater dived in.
He didn’t reappear.
Rabbit got tired of waiting.

S.FORM: manu kemalikali a kisuteku tua tinapi niamadju.
mano kemalikali a kisoteko toa tinapi niamadjo.
S.TRANSL: Well Ant-eater dug right underneath the earth-oven with the tubers in it.

S.FORM: pai kanen aza kakuḍakuḍalan ni qam.
pai kanen aza kakodrakodralan ni qam.
S.TRANSL: And Ant-eater ate up all the big ones.

S.FORM: pai ka makakan taza kakuḍalan, malap tu ita taza tsiqaw, sa qareangałi ni qam.
pai ka makakan taza kakodralan, malap to ita taza ciqaw, sa qareangalji ni qam.
S.TRANSL: When he had finished eating the big ones, he caught a fish and held it in his mouth.
He came out of the water at last with the (mythical) ‘sheath-like’ fish in his mouth.
“Where have you been?” said Rabbit.

S.FORM: "qemałuqałup aken, qalian, tusa marutsiqełap," aya ti qam.
"qemaljoqaljop aken, qalian, tosa marociqeljap," aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: “I’ve been hunting and hunting for this fish, friend,” said Ant-eater.

S.FORM: "ari, qalian, tja sutapiaw anga tja tinapi," aya ti lutjuk.
"ari, qalian, tja sotapiaw anga tja tinapi," aya ti lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, friend, let’s get the roasted tubers out of the earth-oven,” said Rabbit.
“Right, let’s,” said Ant-eater.
So off went the friends.
Ant-eater uncovered the earth-oven.

S.FORM: "ainu anga, qalian, a tja tinapi?" aya ti qam.
"aino anga, qalian, a tja tinapi?" aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: “Where are the tubers we roasted, friend?” said Ant-eater.
“I don’t know,” said Rabbit.
“Well come on, friend, let’s defecate.

S.FORM: a patseliliq ki mavan a nakeman.
a paceliliq ki mavan a nakeman.
S.TRANSL: The one who makes a spluttering noise will be the one who has eaten the tubers.

S.FORM: beluuk nu aya, ika uri nakeman," aya ti qam.
belook no aya, ika ori nakeman," aya ti qam.
S.TRANSL: The one who breaks wind will be the one who hasn’t eaten them,” said Ant-eater.
So the friends went to defecate.

S.FORM: "pai katjaisangasu," aya ti qam tjai lutjuk.
"pai katjaisangaso," aya ti qam tjai lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “You go first,” said Ant-eater to Rabbit.
Rabbit made a spluttering noise.
“Now it’s your turn,” he said to Ant-eater.
Ant-eater broke wind.
“Right then, friend;

S.FORM: saka ika tisun a nakeman tua tja tinapi?" aya ti qam tjai lutjuk.
saka ika tison a nakeman toa tja tinapi?" aya ti qam tjai lotjok.
S.TRANSL: so it was you who ate the tubers we had roasted, wasn’t it?” said Ant-eater to Rabbit.

S.FORM: "pai ari, qalian, pałałama-i," aya ti qam tjai lutjuk.
"pai ari, qalian, paljaljama-i," aya ti qam tjai lotjok.
S.TRANSL: “Well come on, friend, let’s try setting fire to one another,” said Ant-eater to Rabbit.
“Right, let’s,” said Rabbit.
“Wait a minute,” said Ant-eater.

S.FORM: pai kemali a kisamuła ti qam tua kalipatan nimadju.
pai kemali a kisamolja ti qam toa kalipatan nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: So Ant-eater dug himself a hiding-place as fast as he could.
When he had finished digging, Ant-eater said to Rabbit: “All right now, friend, go in where the grass is thickest (?).

S.FORM: kipapaulingavu, qalian," aya ti qam tjai lutjuk.
kipapaolingavo, qalian," aya ti qam tjai lotjok.
S.TRANSL: Look out, friend!”
So Rabbit went right in.
“Ready,” said Rabbit.
Ant-eater set fire to the grass.
Rabbit got burnt.
Ant-eater came to look at him.
Rabbit had his teeth bared (in death).

S.FORM: kitseviqan aza ḍiḍi ni lutjuk, sa paqareangałan tjaimadju.
kiceviqan aza dridri ni lotjok, sa paqareangaljan tjaimadjo.
S.TRANSL: Ant-eater sliced off Rabbit’s penis, and stuck it in Rabbit’s mouth.
“Go on, eat Rabbit’s penis,” he said.
amin
